intro: Myrobalanus actinophylla, commonly known as the white kappaphycus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to eastern Australia and is characterized by its small, white flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in heathlands and along the coastlines of New South Wales and Queensland. The plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated for its hardy nature and ability to withstand coastal conditions.
